WRITING.TEXT: I provoked him but for the first time my boyfriend said my weight was unattractive. He said something afterward to ease the blow and he tends to lash out without thinking so I don't know how much he meant it. No one I've been with has ever said I was unattractive in any way before so it feels kind of bad. I either thought that I wouldn't care or that he would never say anything like that. Blegh. I provoked him by saying that a certain behavior was unattractive (he was bashing on someone a bit) so I feel like I kind of deserve it, plus I guess it's nice to know the truth.

All of this so much. :( People are super dense. I've had to ask family members to stop commenting on my body, which is honestly really awkward and hard to do, but sometimes just has to be done. People really do think they are just being complimentative and need to be told straight up that it's not welcome.

Yeah let's only treat people for eating disorders when they are on the brink of death. :) I don't think your annoyance with the terminology trumps awareness of warning signs and preventative care for eating disorders. At the worst of my eating disorder when I was passing out daily and hospitalized for mineral deficiency and tachycardia with a BMI of 15, I did not have amenorrhea. Guess I didn't have an eating disorder. I get what you're saying but like myself, some people are overweight when their eating disorders start.
Ahh thank you! :D
Aw, thank you! I covered most of it with my shorts haha. When I was pregnant I got terrible deep purple stretch marks; even my doctor was shocked. They've gotten a lot better though.

Thank you! Honestly I just do a 2 minute plank everyday. Sometimes at the gym I'll do those reverse sit up exercises where you lift your legs at a right angle to your body on one of those vertical dip knee raise stations.

I average about 1000 net a day. I drive a lot, exercise kind of a lot and need my brain to be at least somewhat active for school. I'm also pretty small already and if I drop weight too quickly it will alarm the people close to me. I make a point to be seen eating normal amounts of food.
You are gorgeous
Pregnancy unfortunately messed up the skin on my stomach, but finally getting a little more ab definition. [redacted]
"I'd do nothing." Yeah we know.

I eat above 1000 nearly everyday and I'm definitely disordered. I knowingly eat at a number that still causes me to slowly lose weight when I don't need to. Hell, when I had a BMI of 15 I usually never ate below 800 cals. Never really fasted. Still ended up hospitalized with many deficiencies. Still would have eventually keeled over and died if I had kept on like I was.
My legs are sore all the time. I do an hour of cardio everyday and I'm afraid it's not the muscles breaking down and rebuilding, they're just breaking down. :(
Late but arm/hand tendons [redacted]

So I usually go out looking very plain and wearing baggy clothes. This in addition to the resting bitch face usually keeps the attention away. Yesterday, it was very hot out and I wore a crop top. I got a love letter on my car. No more crop tops then. Have to agree with smokesanddietcokes, a lot of guys SAY they like "thicc" girls or whatever but I think just as many or more like very slim girls.
But yeah, dressing down usually works. I love the idea of only getting attention when I want it (which is not very often) and only then doing makeup and nice clothes.
One time an ultrasound technician told me I had a very nice reproductive system.
Definitely. Just today I thought my face looked extra thin and that I looked like a zombie. Thought to myself wow I should probably at least eat to maintenance today; probably won't happen though :(

I lived in France for a couple months and my food habits honestly were not very different than in the US. The community of 20 somethings I usually hung out with regularly had candy, pizza, and beer around. I probably ate more than usual actually, because I wanted to try all the different things I'd never tried before. Definitely walked more though.
I have jeans of various brands made in various years ranging from size zero to size 6 that all fit. It's pretty much a joke these days when people use a clothing to define their body type.
I lost 20 pounds in about 6 weeks but it was after a kind of traumatic event. I was so upset so I'm not sure how much I was actually eating.
I spent some time wandering around Paris completely lost it probably burned a lot of calories. Very easy to overeat there too, btw.
That would be sooo cool.
avoiding the scale so dunno exact weight [redacted]

If I get through today without binging I will have gone a week without, which I feel like I haven't done in months. Tomorrow is going to be a very high stress day so I'm going to try and do extra well today. I actually have no idea what I weigh atm but I feel small which is enough for now.
Nope, but if it's a lot of calories it better taste fucking divine.

I hardly put any effort into my appearance other than my weight. My hair/clothes is usually pretty sloppy, and I'll use makeup to cover up blemishes but that's about it. I know I could probably look really good if I put more effort in but bleeegh no energy.

I've been everywhere from overweight to underweight and sweat very easily no matter what weight. I actually hate the heat so much that I'm more depressed during the summer months. Really hoping to move somewhere less sunny one day.
d'awww
Wow this person really wants everyone to just sit around and eat and feel as horrible as she does.
Sooo much secondhand embarrassment for this woman.

How much are women's bodies really supposed to change from teenage to adulthood though? I was basically done growing and had a "woman's body" at age 14. It's really more about body shape and desired clothing style than age.

Kind of on a similar vein, but there's also some people here that seem to think they speak for everyone who has or has had a restrictive eating disorder. Stuff like... "An anorexic person would never eat that." Yeah sorry that's not always true. At a BMI of 15 something I could still trick people into thinking I was eating normally by eating a large meal in front of them. Not all anorexics sit around counting out individual pieces of cereal or are never seen in public eating a normal amount of food. It's a very deceitful disorder, not a lifetime movie.

Been about 3 months since I've seen my long distance boyfriend and this is definitely the point where it starts to get pretty difficult. It's going to be at least 2 more months as well. :( Also I'm smoking too much lately. -_-
